titleStmt.title: To MARY ANNE STIRLING,Mary Anne (Fanny) Stirling, née Kehl (1813-95; Dictionary of National Biography), actress, who excelled in comedy, on the stage certainly from 1832. Married 1832, Edward Lambert (1807- 94), and the couple took on the names Mr and Mrs Stirling (separated c.1838). Dogged by poor health, she turned in 1860s to teaching elocution and giving readings. Married, after Lambert’s death, Sir Charles Gregory (1817-98). 5 AUGUST 1869

dateline.placeName: OFFICE OF ALL THE YEAR ROUND,

body.p: I have received both your notes, but much regret that I cannot make an appointment with you “between now and Saturday,” as I am away directly, holiday-making.After several days at the All the Year Round Office, CD spent the weekend at Gad’s Hill. You do not want my permission to read Mrs. Nickleby (so far as I know), but you have it freely.Readings by Mrs Stirling at Leeds, Sheffield and Whitby (27, 29 Sep, 1 Oct) advertised in The Times (25 Sep); at Whitby, she read from Shakespeare (The Times, 2 Oct).
